page.title: 12A DEVON VILLAGE.
page.content: In Coffinswell there are many lanes.They are narrow yet still two way & usually steep.Often these lanes are used to separate fields.they have high hedges on each side consisting of grasses,wild roses,cowparsley,campions and many other small flowers.The lanes are not tarmaced but just worn down stones.The hedges date back to the middle ages and provide good habitat for animals.There are many "chocolate box" cottages such as are seen on jigsaw puzzles etc.They have thatched roofs and are usually stone washed. Inside the cottages usually have low roofs and wooden beams.Quite a lot have lead windows.One cottage,350 yrs old has a "Rumainian" thatched roof.The ridge has to be re_thatched every 10_15 yrs.but the roof should last 50 yrs.Properties are expensive because of the charm of the village.
